Directions: Read the information below, then answer each question that follows.
Content: Propane (C₃H₈) is a flammable gas at standard temperature and pressure. It can be compressed (put under pressure) and stored in steel containers as a liquid. Propane tanks are often used as the fuel source for barbecue grills, as well as residential (home) heating. A valve on the steel container releases the liquid propane, which vaporizes (turns into gas) when it is returned to standard temperature and pressure.
